video:video.video:title: Recap Enterprise Connect hybrid work trends, generative AI
video:video.video:description: Analysts discuss the top trends from Enterprise Connect 2023, including generative AI and how to make hybrid work more inclusive.

video:video.video:title: 5 tips to get started with Zoom meetings for beginners
video:video.video:description: While online conferencing services can't fully replicate a face-to-face meeting, these Zoom tips can help employees make the most of their remote meetings.

video:video.video:title: Cloud video services spark adoption of conferencing tools
video:video.video:description: Video conferencing is becoming prevalent in most unified communications products. Cloud video services, in particular, have fueled the adoption of video conferencing tools.

video:video.video:title: Open-office plans prompt noise-mitigation technology
video:video.video:description: From noise-cancellation headsets to officewide acoustic management systems, organizations are looking to quell noisy chatter associated with open-office environments.

video:video.video:title: New contact center services boost customer engagements
video:video.video:description: Contextual communications within contact center services can improve customer engagement. New products from Oracle and TTEC aim to ease the exchange between customers and agents.

video:video.video:title: How to select a UCaaS provider amid market volatility
video:video.video:description: As mergers and acquisitions swirl around the UCaaS market, organizations need to inspect potential vendors' long-term financial stability and product roadmaps.

video:video.video:title: New Microsoft Teams features on deck, but more work needed
video:video.video:description: Microsoft has made progress, as it moves Skype for Business features into Microsoft Teams. But more capabilities, especially enterprise voice features, are needed.

video:video.video:title: API vendors show how to build web-calling features
video:video.video:description: In this video, see how API vendors are providing the building blocks to support web-based communications. Browser-based calling, in particular, is a fundamental feature.

video:video.video:title: Voice applications, analytics suites part of UC evolution
video:video.video:description: In this video, Vonage and Plantronics demonstrate their latest innovations. See how a voice API and analytics suite are helping advance enterprise communications.

video:video.video:title: Unified communications platforms get contextual, customizable
video:video.video:description: UC clients often undergo evolutionary development, rather than revolutionary changes. See how two vendors in particular are looking to advance enterprise communications.

video:video.video:title: Cisco Spark Board, Polycom camera refocus on video conference rooms
video:video.video:description: While big boardroom video conferencing deployments are perhaps a thing of the past, video meetings could find a new home in small and medium-sized meeting rooms.

video:video.video:title: Do communication APIs complement or challenge UC products?
video:video.video:description: Embedded communications, like click-to-call or click-to-video, can enhance business workflows. But are these new API tools ready for enterprise use?

video:video.video:title: Unified communications vendors and users continue consolidation
video:video.video:description: In this video with analyst Irwin Lazar, explore some key market trends, including industry consolidation, UC analytics and the emergence of artificial intelligence tools.

video:video.video:title: Cloud unified communications carrying more clout
video:video.video:description: Current cloud trends in unified communications include hybrid deployments and an increase in video conferencing adoption. But is hybrid just one step toward a pure-cloud model?
